name: Media Tracker
author: TheBitCraft

sections.description:
Optimize your WordPress site’s performance with Media Tracker, the ultimate tool for managing your media files. Effortlessly identify, organize, and clean up unused images to ensure your media library remains efficient and clutter-free. With Media Tracker, you can easily track where each image is used across posts, pages, and custom post types, making your website more streamlined and user-friendly.

Features

**ðŸ”¥ Media Usage: With the Media Usage feature, gain a comprehensive overview of where each image is utilized throughout your WordPress site. This includes all posts, pages, and custom post types. Easily locate and manage your media files to ensure optimal usage of your assets. By identifying media usage across all content, you can prevent redundancy, maintain a well-organized media library, and enhance the overall performance of your site.

**ðŸ”¥ Cleaner: Optimize your WordPress site’s storage and performance with the Cleaner feature. This tool identifies and lists all unused images in your media library, allowing you to review and remove unnecessary files with just a few clicks. By regularly cleaning up your unused media, you free up valuable storage space, boost your site’s speed, and maintain a lean and efficient website. Keep your WordPress site performing at its best with a tidy, well-maintained media library.

**ðŸ”¥ Duplicate Images: The Duplicate Images feature helps you manage similar visual content that may be taking up unnecessary space in your media library. Media Tracker identifies duplicate imagesâ€”even those with different names, sizes, or formats (like JPG and PNG)â€”by comparing their perceptual hashes. Easily filter and manage these duplicates within your WordPress Media Library to prevent storage waste and improve site efficiency.
sections.installation:
Minimum Requirements

  • PHP version 5.6.0 or greater (PHP 7.2 or greater is recommended)
  • MySQL version 5.0 or greater (MySQL 5.6 or greater is recommended)

Automatic installation

The automatic installation is the easiest way to install any plugin in WordPress. You can perform an automatic installation by logging in to your WordPress dashboard, navigating to the “Plugins” menu and clicking on the “Add New” button.

This will open up a page showing all the available plugins in WordPress. In the search field, type Media Tracker. The search result will show you our Media Tracker plugin. You can then see the detailed info by clicking on “More Details” and to install just click on the “Install Now” button.

Manual installation

Go to Dashboard > Plugins > Add New, then upload media-tracker.zip file and click Install Now.
sections.faq:
Q. Where can I get support?

A. You can get support by posting on the support section of this plugin on the WordPress plugin directory, or via email at: hello@thebitcraft.com

Q. Can I use my existing WordPress theme?

A. Sure, you can use your existing WordPress theme with Media Tracker.

Q. Where can I report a bug?

A. Found a bug? Please let us know by posting on the support section of this plugin on the WordPress plugin directory or directly via email at: hello@thebitcraft.com

1.0.2 [27/08/2024]

  • Duplicate Image features added

1.0.1 [25/08/2024]

  • The query argument of wpdb prepare issue fixed
  • Deprecated passing null to parameter issue fixed

1.0.0 [12/07/2024]

  • Initial version released
